channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Europe alarmed by Trump's Greenland push
item.description: Europe is increasingly alarmed by Trump's talk of annexing Greenland, an autonomous Danish territory in the EU and NATO, especially after the U.S. incursion in Venezuela last weekend.
item.content:encoded: Europe is increasingly alarmed by Trump's talk of annexing Greenland, an autonomous Danish territory in the EU and NATO, especially after the U.S. incursion in Venezuela last weekend.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: FDA commissioner explains new food pyramid, encourages greater uptake of core childhood vaccines
item.description: Martin Makary, commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration, on the push against ultra processed foods and added sugar, and what that could mean for school lunches and food labels, and says the administration's hierarchy of vaccines is meant to encourage childhood vaccine uptake.
item.content:encoded: Martin Makary, commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration, on the push against ultra processed foods and added sugar, and what that could mean for school lunches and food labels, and says the administration's hierarchy of vaccines is meant to encourage childhood vaccine uptake.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: How does NPR report on Venezuela?
item.description: Eyder Peralta, NPR international correspondent, on racing to the Venezuela border after the U.S. captured Nicolás Maduro, and the obstacles keeping journalists from getting into the country.
item.content:encoded: Eyder Peralta, NPR international correspondent, on racing to the Venezuela border after the U.S. captured Nicolás Maduro, and the obstacles keeping journalists from getting into the country.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: The legacy of Thomas Paine's 'Common Sense' on its 250th anniversary
item.description: 250 years after Thomas Paine published 'Common Sense', what can we learn from the revolutionary work today?
item.content:encoded: 250 years after Thomas Paine published 'Common Sense', what can we learn from the revolutionary work today?
item.dc:creator: Avery Keatley

item.title: TEED releases his new album 'Always With Me'
item.description: Orlando Higginbottom, the electronic music artist who performs as TEED, on the sounds and influences behind his new album, 'Always With Me'.
item.content:encoded: Orlando Higginbottom, the electronic music artist who performs as TEED, on the sounds and influences behind his new album, 'Always With Me'.
item.dc:creator: Kira Wakeam

item.title: Britain executed Ruth Ellis in 1955. Now her granddaughter wants justice
item.description: In 1955, Ruth Ellis was hanged for killing her abusive partner. Her case became one of the catalysts for abolishing the death penalty in the UK, and 70 years later her family is seeking a posthumous pardon.
item.content:encoded: In 1955, Ruth Ellis was hanged for killing her abusive partner. Her case became one of the catalysts for abolishing the death penalty in the UK, and 70 years later her family is seeking a posthumous pardon.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: A new voice takes the mic to continue Art Laboe's oldies show
item.description: After the death of legendary DJ Art Laboe, his beloved oldies radio show has found a new host in Angel "Baby" Rodriguez, who's continuing Laboe's tradition of love dedications and connections across California.
item.content:encoded: After the death of legendary DJ Art Laboe, his beloved oldies radio show has found a new host in Angel "Baby" Rodriguez, who's continuing Laboe's tradition of love dedications and connections across California.
item.dc:creator: Gabriel J. Sánchez

item.title: This week in science: elephant trunks, butterfly migration and a hot galaxy cluster
item.description: NPR's Short Wave talks about elephants' sniffing abilities, the remarkable migration of painted lady butterflies and a surprising discovery about the early universe.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Short Wave talks about elephants' sniffing abilities, the remarkable migration of painted lady butterflies and a surprising discovery about the early universe.
item.dc:creator: Berly McCoy

item.title: The 1970s hostage story of 'Dead Man's Wire' speaks across the decades
item.description: Gus Van Sant's police thriller Dead Man's Wire is a true-crime dramatization of a 1977 hostage incident in Indianapolis.
item.content:encoded: Gus Van Sant's police thriller Dead Man's Wire is a true-crime dramatization of a 1977 hostage incident in Indianapolis.
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: Two parents reflect on giving back after Camp Mystic tragedy
item.description: After deadly floods hit Central Texas in July, families whose daughters died at a sleepaway camp are keeping their legacies alive. We speak to two parents who helped create the Heaven's 27 Foundation.
item.content:encoded: After deadly floods hit Central Texas in July, families whose daughters died at a sleepaway camp are keeping their legacies alive. We speak to two parents who helped create the Heaven's 27 Foundation.
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger
